      • setStep

        public void setStep(Step step)

      • getStep

        public Step getStep()
        Description copied from interface: Action
        Get the step that this action is executed from. Every action starts from a step in the workflow and transfers the workflow into other (or the same) step or steps. This method returns the step from which the action can be executed from.
        Specified by:
        getStep in interface Action
        Returns:
        the step

      • getParameters

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getParameters()
        Get the parameters from the action definition as well as from the action declaration, and merge the two maps and return the result. In case key has value in both of the maps then the one specified for the definition (under the XML tag of the step) is ruling overwriting the other one.
        Specified by:
        getParameters in interface Action
        Returns:
        the merged parameter map

      • performPre

        public java.lang.Object performPre()
                            throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                   java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                   java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Description copied from interface: Action
        Execute the pre-function of the action.

        This method is called when the action should be performed in two phases. The first phase is the pre-function and gathering user input. The second phase is to execute the validator and the post-function.

        When the action is performed in two phase the pre-function returns a transientState object that the post function and the validator may use to perform their methods.

        Specified by:
        performPre in interface Action
        Returns:
        the transient state object the pre-function creates
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.lang.InstantiationException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException

      • performPost

        public Step[] performPost(java.lang.Object transientObject,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> userInput)
                   throws ValidatorFailedException,
                          java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          java.lang.InstantiationException,
                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Description copied from interface: Action
        Execute the post-function of the action.

        This method is called when the action should be performed in two phases as described in the documentation of the method {

        Specified by:
        performPost in interface Action
        Parameters:
        transientObject - the transient state object returned by the pre-function
        userInput - the user-input that was gathered after calling pre-function
        Returns:
        the steps to which the action transfers from the old step. (Not all the steps the work flow is in after the action, only the ones that replace the step we transit from.) It returns null if the action postFunction returned null. In that case the steps the work flow is in remain the same.
        Throws:
        ValidatorFailedException - #performPre(StepDefinition step, ActionDefinition action).

        The method should also alter the steps of the work flow object, so the next call to getSteps() should return the steps that the work flow is after the execution of the action.

        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.lang.InstantiationException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException

      • getResults

        public Result[] getResults()
        Get the array of results that belong to this action. If it was created before and is available through the private field results then returns it. If it was not created before then the field is created. The method gets the action definition that belongs to this action and gets the array of the result definitions. After that it creates an array that has the same length as the definition and fills it with simple result objects.

        Finally the simple result objects will all point to their corresponding result definition so that later they can perform the method getDefinition()

        Specified by:
        getResults in interface Action
        Returns:
        the array of results.

      • getResult

        public Result getResult(java.lang.String name)
        Return the result that has the name 'name'.

        The implementation gets the array of possible results (this creates the result array if it did not exist) and searches for a result in the array that bears a definition that has the name. When it is found it is returned.

        If no result is found for the name then null is returned.

        Specified by:
        getResult in interface Action
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the result we need
        Returns:
        the result object

        public void join(java.lang.String[] stepNames)
        Description copied from interface: Action
        Join the steps listed in the argument list into this action. The steps are listed by their names and not the actual steps. For more explanation {
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
